intro: Elachanthera, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers surrounded by silvery leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Elachanthera has a compact growth habit and is often used in rock gardens or as a border plant due to its ornamental value. Its foliage is covered in fine, silvery hairs, which give it its common name.
